message.body: I'm doing great, how about you 2?
@winston Cool, I'm a hobby coder and recently tried myself at web dev
What do you guys think about IPFS? http://ipfs.io
I wish zeronet + ipfs is gonna work well together
I also really like the idea of Filecoin
I'd love to learn all about it so I can contribute as well, might take a while though
Hmm are you sure loligods site works with ipfs? I'm trying to watch a video but it doesn't work, or maybe it's just too slow
does it work for any of you?
I did but there was an error, wait a sec
Ohh the number of open files apparently is limited to 256 on my system, thanks os x
I enjoy my Mac for coding a lot, I don't wanna continue the Mac vs Windows vs Others war here xD
Although lately I am considering to move to Linux, because os x has more and more flaws..
Tbh os x isn't really a box, it's Unix and has nothing to do with iOS (which is an actual box)
I do Swift, learning Haskell and Rust and Web stuff, unwillingly learning C and C++, wanting to learn Idris, sometimes using bash
Yeah Macs aren't closed in at all, the only protection it has which is more than normal is that there are system protected files you (and installed apps) can't mess with because it could trash it
I'm gonna go now, need to restart and do other stuff, see ya :D
Fun fact: I may be able to get minesweeper to work on my keyboard
The keyboard has a lot of keys and are ordered mostly like a grid. It also has 3 LED, which I could use to give feedback to the player
Haha no, the 3 single color LED's are the only user feedback possible
The user could hold keys to query that mine spot, LED1: whether it's digged LED2: Whether it's flagged LED3: Blinks as many times as there are mines near it
All LED's blinking means game over

A more useful thing I plan to do is have a Mac/Windows/Linux mode so you can press a certain key combo to trigger a certain action on every platform (e.g. Ctrl-S gets sent as Cmd-S on Mac to save something)
Being able to code the keyboard opens so many possibilities, I also integrated my most frequently used passwords right into the firmware so I don't need to type them every time
Just have to make sure I don't push the source code to github
I have a question, what even ARE hubs?
Sooo how do I use a different Hub? On their sites they just say that you should use ZeroMe to browse profiles, but I can't find anything in ZeroMe
Oh I see how it works now, thanks
And all the hubs you use are in the Merged section at ZeroHello
Hey guys, you should check out the just launched Alpha of AKASHA, a social network using Ethereum and IPFS. Website is http://akasha.world

Just give me domain name and the zero hash and i'll set it up for 36000 blocks (~6 months)

damnit now i watched like an hour of these videos

it's really hard to stay on here because no notifications
I am afraid I may not be long lasting here
Do you know how updates to the chat work?
Like if I wanted to make a quick app that notifies me whenever someone wrote something

I am using Programmers Dvorak, it's pretty cool once you get the hang of it. I think I learned it by doing typing tests online as much as possible for a few weeks. Transitioning is weird but you're glad once you've done it.
Actually I've been using a customized version of programmers dvorak for a while now. Some symbols shifted and numbers rearranged.
I'm gonna go now, see ya some other time
The most annoying character on Dvorak I find is the "L", so hard to reach without moving fingers

its annoying, because you need to manually click restart every time
